M

main(String[]) - Static method in class WebServer
Run the web server.
Message - Class in <Unnamed>
A Message object represents an HTML message in abstract.
A Message has a header comprising a start line, followed by zero or more header fields of the form '<name>:<value>', followed by a carriage return and line feed.
A Message may have a body.
Message() - Constructor for class Message
Called by a sub class to instantiate variables that hold header field data.

P

Read an HTTP request from the given input stream and return it as a Request object.
process(Request) - Method in class GetRequestProcessor
Process a given HTTP GET Request message, returning the result in an HTTP Response message.
process(Request) - Method in class RequestProcessor
Process the given request, creating and returning an HTTP Response.
Requires that request.getMethodType().equals(this.getMethodType()).

R

Request - Class in <Unnamed>
Represents an HTTP Request type of message.
Request() - Constructor for class Request
 
Request(HTTPMethodType, String, String) - Constructor for class Request
Create a Request message with a request-line composed of the given method type, URI and HTTP version.
RequestProcessor - Class in <Unnamed>
A RequestProcessor is a class of object that contains the logic necessary for a processing particular type of HTTP request (GET, POST, etc).
A concrete sub type of RequestProcessor is required for processing an actual
request e.g.
RequestProcessor(HTTPMethodType) - Constructor for class RequestProcessor
Called by a concrete subtype to set the type of HTTP method that can be processed.
Response - Class in <Unnamed>
Represents a Response type of HTTP message.
A Response message has a status line comprising HTTP version, status code and status description.
Response(String) - Constructor for class Response
Create a Response message that adheres to the given version of the HTTP.

S

send(OutputStream, Response) - Static method in class Response
Send the given Response via the given output stream.
The method writes the start line, followed by the header fields (one per line), followed by a blank line and then the message body.
NOTE That lines are terminated with a carriage return and line feed.
setBody(byte[]) - Method in class Response
Set the message body.
(The effect of the method is this.setBody(new ByteArrayInputStream(data)).)
setBody(InputStream) - Method in class Response
Set the input stream from which the message body can be read.
For use when the body of the message is a file.
setHeaderField(String, String) - Method in class Message
Add (or update) a header field.
setStatus(HTTPStatus) - Method in class Response
Set the response status.
